location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, states that, following instructions from Andrew Jukes, the late Political Agent in the Persian Gulf, he has procured and shipped 104 young date trees, which have been placed in fifty large chests and consigned to the Governor of Bombay, Mountstuart Elphinstone. Dow encloses a bill of lading (not included) and a statement of expenses (also not included).
